DataElement.preferredName: Patient Vital Signs Heart Rate Supine Position Physical Examination Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the measurment in beats per minute relating to a physical examination (a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment) of a patient's heart rate (the number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute) while in posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Vital Signs Heart Rate Supine Position Physical Examination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a physical examination (a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment) of a patient's heart rate (the number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute) while in posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Vital Signs Test Name Heart Rate Supine Position Physical Examination
Property.preferredDefinition: Basic human physiologic functioning as demonstrated by evaluation of pulse, temperature, respiratory rate, and blood pressure measurements.:No value exists.:A posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: The act of assessing an individual's current temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, pulse oxygenation, and blood pressure.
The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute.
A posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the heart rate measured in beats per minute.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form
